qas.question: What type of vessels were part of a major role in defeating Japan?
What percent did submarines make up in the US Navy fighting Japan?
What did submarines sinking Japanese ships do?
What happened to the Japanese fleet when nearly all oil imports were cut off?

context: U.S. <a0_0>submarines<a0_0/>, as well as some British and Dutch vessels, operating from bases at Cavite in the Philippines (1941–42); Fremantle and Brisbane, Australia; Pearl Harbor; Trincomalee, Ceylon; Midway; and later Guam, played a major role in defeating Japan, even though submarines made up a small proportion of the Allied navies—less than <a1_0>two percent<a1_0/> in the case of the US Navy. Submarines <a2_0>strangled Japan<a2_0/> by sinking its merchant fleet, intercepting many troop transports, and cutting off nearly all the oil imports essential to weapons production and military operations. By early 1945 Japanese oil supplies were so limited that its fleet was <a3_0>virtually stranded<a3_0/>.
